author: ragnaroktomorrow

text:
So, after my friend and I finished practicing Gustav Holst's 'Mars' and Johann de Meij's 'Gandalf,' I decided to put this song on for my friend and see what he had to say. Two minutes in, when I told him it was from a video game from the 90's his jaw dropped.
The idea that someone could write music for a video game that was more classical sounding than video game sounding blew his mind (and he's played LOTS of Final Fantasy. Eat that FFVII!).
author: Mandrakos

text: It was a big deal back in the day to have music in a game performed by an actual orchestra. I'm not a big Grandia fan but I'll admit that pieces like this made a big difference in-game.

text: I started to play Grandia and figured the music would be pretty standard rpg music fare.  But having the symphonic music within the game blew me away!  Definitely adds to the whole adventure theme of the game, making it twice as epic.  Probably explains why I love the DQVIII soundtrack so much too.
